website_summaries.verdict: A thought-provoking game designed for ages 10 and up. If you're looking for a way to grow your relationships offline, this is a great conversation starter.
pros: Easily portable, and the game process is simple yet engaging
Born out of crowdfunding, this game is a hit with folks who want something fun and different
cons: This isn't a game that can be played with the same people day after day due to the familiarity factor of the cards
However, it's great for once or twice a year with the family

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Played this twice so far with my roommates and genuinely enjoyed it both times! It's much easier to say "let's play Vertellis" than to say "let's have a genuine conversation and connect" but the results are still the same.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your comfort level
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game with interesting questions. I thought it would be something my family could play several times and still enjoy. But we only played it once, and no one really wants to play it anymore. I'm not sure if the questions seem old once you've played it, or if it's just my family not wanting to get personal and play that type of game again. It would probably be great for someone who is very social and has lots of different friend groups or a large family that like to hang out and play games, that don't mind getting a little personal. If you don't like to share personal information, it's not the game for you.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee Megadoodoo

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: Played this with 14 people, family and friends, on Thanksgiving. It was really cool and we look forward to playing it again!! Great for any size group - good for team building and getting to know each other better.
customer_reviews.author: J Cohen

customer_reviews.title: A great thought for getting people off of their phones!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I had hopes for this game, and we finally played it...I had to drag people into the game but they played. It was a great way to talk, and to learn things about each other. Some kids were bored but we had a lot of laughs. I think the only problem I have is the long tern use of this game. Once you have done it once I can see playing again for another year!.. I think if I share it with every friend I have we would consider it a good investment. For 20 bucks I am thinking I should just collect phone and ask my own questions.
customer_reviews.author: Steve William Mattero

customer_reviews.title: Great for English Practice, too!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my ESOL class to help my students practice speaking in English. They loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Renaud

customer_reviews.title: Great game for connecting with loved ones
customer_reviews.text: I play this with my spouse often - just a few cards at a time, as a way to reconnect and have meaningful conversation. We've also played it with our extended family, and everyone enjoyed it. Great questions, leads to great conversations and thoughtful responses.
customer_reviews.author: Amjad Najim

customer_reviews.title: Talk, don't Tweet!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent game to play with adult friends. Even when we didn't exactly follow the rules, for example we told stories from our whole lives instead of just last year, the results were fascinating and hilarious. It is an excellent Christmas gift to be opened Christmas eve and could be used by the whole family as a thoughtful way to foster connections. The idea of "Tell me more" is one that deserves attention during the Reign of The Twitter King.
customer_reviews.author: Joan C. Cullinane

customer_reviews.title: Only for large groups and odd deep personal questions
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this "game". It requires a very large group (ie, turn to the person 3 to your right...."and calls players "participants" on some cards. This seems like it was a kumbaya retreat activity and the facilitators said, "hey people love this activity, let's make it into a game and sell it." Maybe refine and try a 2.0 version that really is more of a game....
customer_reviews.author: T. Fontaine

customer_reviews.title: You would do better creating your own game
customer_reviews.text: The game was too simple and too repetitive. I like the idea, to get people to put down their phones and connect... but at a table of 9 people, the cards were too repetitive and there were very few of them. I think one could create slips of paper on your computer that would ask more and offer more opportunity to get to know one another.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money- my extended family (all ages) did not enjoy at all
customer_reviews.text: My family and I played it once and did not enjoy it (and we are conversationalists and game people). I contacted the company for a return/refund, but since it was past the 30 day purchase (we didn't play it right after purchasing), I'm stuck with it. I would not recommend you spend your money on this "game".
customer_reviews.author: Robin in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed game.
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed game. I bought 1 as a gift and we ended up playing that evening as well and I do believe we had a more memorable evening thanks to the game
customer_reviews.author: R. Alex

customer_reviews.title: Beware: This cannot be returned!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game thinking my family might enjoy playing it over the holidays. My teenage daughters took one look at the questions, declared that it looked like a boring worksheet for school, and we immediately put it away. This would not have been a problem, or a one star review, if I could have just returned it to Amazon like any other item. Amazon says this item is not returnable- no where on the item description does it say this item is not returnable. Now I'm out $20. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: M. Creech

customer_reviews.title: Great connection game!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it a while ago and brought it to Christmas vaca. Ages 52, 58, 24, 25, 23, 21. I was worried because we had been playing loud fun obnoxious games and I hesitantly offered this. It definitely isn’t loud and obnoxious. It’s very thoughtful. It also has good progression of questioning from past year to coming year. Really really made you think about answers. Group has to be willing to be honest. We loved it - more than the loud obnoxious ones. Did I get to know things about the people I was playing with? Absolutely - and 3 were my daughters!! But $20? Maybe not. Can you play it over and over with same group - not really.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Delightful dinner conversation
customer_reviews.text: Tired of talking Sports and politics at the dinner table? This is a good game to encourage delightful dinner conversation getting to know your family. I have a passionate family when it comes to politics, religion, and sports. Many dinners have ended up in arguments hurt feelings. We played this game for Thanksgiving and Christmas dinners and the conversation was beautiful. I recommend this game for every family.
customer_reviews.author: omahacheeks

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed. Bought this as a gift and we played it once, but the questions weren't anything special. I doubt my family will ever bring this out again to play after dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: To put it simply: We were underwhelmed. Based on the product information we read, we were optimistic that this could be something fun for the holidays or for students going off to college. It is very basic; questions aren't very interesting and some make it feel as if it's something you would only pull out and use once a year. This game could be so much better than it is.
customer_reviews.author: Writerchick

customer_reviews.title: Ordered the Holiday Edition - seems to be the Classic
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Holiday Edition - this is what was marketed to me and what the invoice states. However, there is nothing on the box or labeling to match this description. It says Classic. So the rating is based on the product not matching the strong marketing - that it would be especially good for winter family gatherings, thus a Holiday Edition. That said, the questions look great and I’m sure we’ll get good use. Didn’t appreciate the confusing marketing though.
customer_reviews.author: LizNewkirk

customer_reviews.title: Very overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I paid about $20 for 48 cards with not particularly insightful questions. It was fun to play but one can only play a few times before exhausting the cards/questions. If you could get these cards for $5 or less, then I would buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Faye Johnson

customer_reviews.title: So much better than politics, religion, or sports!
customer_reviews.text: Played this for Thanksgiving dinner. Best conversation ever! Can't wait for Christmas dinner!
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: My daughter told me to leave an excellent review for this book!
customer_reviews.text: I sent this book to my 16-year-old grandson for his birthday. His mom says if she were going to review it, she would leave an excellent review. He loves it, and he and his friends are enjoying learning all the stuff it teaches them, in her words: "All the boys are having fun with it." I count this as a success at getting them off their video games and teach them about life! Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: J. Weis

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like this game. The questions were not as fun as I was expecting. Just generic questions that you could get from any list on the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M.

customer_reviews.title: Time to reconnect
customer_reviews.text: We played this after the big meal on Thanksgiving, and I was surprised at the level of conversation that it leads you into. Nobody was looking at their phones. People were really talking and reconnecting. We learn things about each other that we didn't know, like the sort of things that's in someone's heart, their secret dreams, their dream vacations, the thing they want most to happen...Every single one of us got teary-eyed or out right cried at least once and we all left loving each other a little bit more.
customer_reviews.author: KY Mudd

customer_reviews.title: Good ice breaker or group fun or deep family conversations.
customer_reviews.text: Great ice breaker or great for friends hanging out who are in the mood for some decent reflection and goal-sharing. Also good for inter-generational conversations. My dad and my son and I took these cards with us on a weekend getaway and played this in our hotel room. It was a very good time. Take time to make moments like these that matter. But it’s not just sappy deep things. Can be used for fun groups too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic, some of the best conversations we've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a girls weekend away. Absolutely fantastic, some of the best conversations we've ever had. It might have taken months even years to draw that information out from my friends. We're a closer group because of it. As a result several women in our party purchased the Married couples version
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Nudge Conversation to Gently Deeper Level
customer_reviews.text: Had a Christmas-time work lunch this week with people I wanted to get to know better. Offered up this deck after we ordered and everyone took a card. As we went around the table, the people responded to prompts such as, "A person who changed your life" or "Most exciting experience" . Before we started, I did a quick scan of the deck and removed, "Your biggest regret" type of card, because I didn't want to trigger a sad or deeper level for this occasion. We heard great stories and everyone enjoyed it. We didn't play for points; just used it for conversation and called it a game.
customer_reviews.author: PalliNurse

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would be more interesting
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use with family for the holidays. Was hoping it would spark some conversation with my family. A lot less questions then I expected. Everyone answered with one liners. I wouldn't call it a game. Nice concept. failed execution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed, overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed! I bought 2 versions of this game to use to play with family visiting soon, and I do not understand why there are only 3 cards/questions in round 2 and 4?!?!?!? Why would anyone play this game more than once? You already know the questions for those rounds. Boring, and way overpriced when similar decks of meaningful question decks have so much more and cost less.
customer_reviews.author: NoPlaceLikeHome

customer_reviews.title: A hit with the family!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I played this game over the thanksgiving break. A wonderful way for us to connect and have meaningful conversations. I’m definitely looking forward to playing it again. Also, I wish they had this game in Spanish for my relatives. :)
customer_reviews.author: A. Eljaiek

customer_reviews.title: Great idea for building a good communication for families
customer_reviews.text: There were some well thought out ideas going into the creation of this game. It was perfect at my sisters Christmas party and perfect for my husband and I and one daughter. But when I had my cousins over for Christmas it was a dud. I think that is because we were tired but also this family communicates better maybe so it just wasn't needed as much. However I gave it to them as a gift and said I could regift it to someone else and they said no they want to keep it :-)
customer_reviews.author: Diane Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Definately a card "game" to buy!
customer_reviews.text: Received my cards on time as promised. VERY impressed with wrapping of all things:) The hard cardboard box lid flips up to give you a very brief history of the game and suggestions while playing; such as "Turn off all electronic devices." Questions that will lead into family/friend discussions. Getting ready to play the game now and did read some of the questions. Like the game already; so glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: IRMA

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: If I wasn't a psychotherapist, maybe these questions would have felt more... inspired. Nothing new for me and my hubby but I'm sure would be great for those who don't philosophy about life as a hobby and study psychology for fun lol:)
customer_reviews.author: Mattie2016

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how often we'll use it but good to have
customer_reviews.text: This turned out exactly what we needed to trigger meaningful conversations on Christmas afternoon. Not sure how often we'll use it but good to have. The questions are a nice balance between personal and general so no one needs to be embarrassed talking about something that they dont want to.
customer_reviews.author: New look!

customer_reviews.title: Conversation Starter
customer_reviews.text: Great discussion starters. I've they have been a hit at family-friends gathering.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Jackson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Do not be fooled by the name of this “game”. This is not at all worth the money. It’s a stack of cards in a box with topics for discussion...topics that could easily be suggested on the internet if you can’t think of these yourself. The “game” isn’t even really a game. The instructions for “playing” and scoring are a sad attempt at trying to justify the price for this stack of cards.... 25% of which are blank and you’re supposed to come up with the idea yourself. Are you kidding me? Don’t waste your money, like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny R. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: One of the most import games a family can add
customer_reviews.text: The perfect family game! We played this while dining as an extended family of 15 in a restaurant. While there were tears, the people around us wanted to know more about the game. We learned so much about each other— as young as 8 and as wide as 65. Our family grew that day :)
customer_reviews.author: Bella Rae

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful & Personal Game to Play With Those Close to You
customer_reviews.text: It is a great game and easy to bring along to any intimate event or gathering. I brought mine to Friendsgiving and I loved hearing from my friends about all these parts of their lives and how they looked back and forward for the year we had and the year to come. I will definitely use it again in a few months. It's not a game to use too frequently though. even in the directions it says to only use with the same group once a year, so you could bring it to a family event, then a friend event, but you have to wait to use it again. You'll see why once you play it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rio

customer_reviews.title: Vertellis great gift for adult kids
customer_reviews.text: Got a set for my son and daughter in law and another for other son and our daughter to share who live on same street out of town. Hope it will spark some conversations for all.
customer_reviews.author: chardt

customer_reviews.title: Good questions but not a game
customer_reviews.text: The questions in Vertellis are thought provoking, but some are hard to answer on depth. It takes a lot of commitment and enthusiasm to turn these questions into a good conversation. It would work just as well as a pamphlet, rather than a card game.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon R Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Great group conversations!
customer_reviews.text: We played this at our Christmas gathering. It started with just the young people but as they shared their answers, the rest of the family was drawn in until we were all sharing and talking and having such a warm, wonderful time together! Excellent for meaningful conversations with those you care about!
customer_reviews.author: Robin M. Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Great for quality family time...
customer_reviews.text: We played this on Christmas Eve with a large family gathering and it turned out so great! We laughed and cried and got the chance to say things that needed to be said while we had the chance (all positive). I am excited to play this game again at our next get-together.
customer_reviews.author: clridenhour

customer_reviews.title: Brings Families Closer Together
customer_reviews.text: Our family played this game at Christmas. Our youngest being 16. I recommend playing with teenagers and/or adults you’d like to know better or grow closer to. There were 6 of us and the game lasted about 40 minutes. It’s all talking and sharing personal experiences and dreams. Gives parents a chance to share with their children and vice versa. Everyone is allowed to be themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Tejada

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Some of the questions did spark interesting responses. There wasn't much motivation to get people to stay engaged.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia B.

customer_reviews.title: not sure who this is for!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews about this "game" it sounded like it would be fun to take away on a family vacation with adult children (ages 25 & 29). They were not impressed and thought it silly! They are avid game players (games like Secret Hitler and Cards against Humanity)...maybe it's good for younger kids and families who don't talk to one another!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: Was excited for the new Thanksgiving game to play post dinner and was disappointed. Did not work for us. Boring, cliche, general questions that did not spark much of a conversation with anyone.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Fun and thoughtful
customer_reviews.text: A group of coworkers and I played this during a work retreat. It was delightful! Really great questions. I do wish there were more questions though. It was a fabulous way to reflect on the past year and dream into where we are going. Plus we laughed and cried.
customer_reviews.author: Sarina

customer_reviews.title: Our Family played this game over the Thanksgiving Holiday. ...
customer_reviews.text: Our Family played this game over the Thanksgiving Holiday. It was Heartwarming to have the teenagers, young adults, aunt, uncles and grandparents communicate on a very personal level.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Ackley

customer_reviews.title: it was fantastic. Eight of us played in New Year’s Eve
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this game would do as it claims. But, it was fantastic. Eight of us played in New Year’s Eve, and it opened up new insights about each other. A great way to spend an evening with friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mueller-Owens

customer_reviews.title: Vertellis
customer_reviews.text: New card game of questions for people to respond to so that they can think through life's questions and others can get to know them in better depth. Good for friends and especially couples, asking the questions we wouldn't/couldn't ask.
customer_reviews.author: Amron_J

customer_reviews.title: Quality was good , just not for what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I think I was expecting something else. Bought to play at Christmas. Thought the questions were a little too thought provoking for Christmas. Wanted something a little lighter to play. But may play at another time.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Clean

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward
customer_reviews.text: Never got to play, we had awful weather Thanksgiving Day. Had to cancel table chairs and jumpers. Each family did their own dinner to risky to travel. But was looking forward to this game. Maybe for Christmas Cheer.
customer_reviews.author: Delma Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Questions are kind of boring
customer_reviews.text: I thought this might be a little more fun for a family gathering, but I found the questions to be quite boring. Sorry to have spent $20 on the pack of cards, as I don't see anyone taking much interest in this game.
customer_reviews.author: mips

customer_reviews.title: Just what I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: People were sharing them around, not playing the game exactly, but asking questions and enjoying them. I love the prompts for conversation starters with a bunch of people I don't know so well.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Ryan

customer_reviews.title: not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: My bad, for some reason I thought this was a good idea. Just not for me . I tried to return them but it wasn't worth the shipping. May just gift it to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game for getting to know new friends!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Vertellis for an annual girls' night in. After only a few drinks, we played. We didn't get through round 1 but had so many meaningful conversations based on the questions we read. I will use this game in any situation where I am meeting new friends! I highly recommend it for friends and family, new and old! There is something to be learned from every card!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Headline
customer_reviews.text: Very clever questions allow some candor, getting-to-know-you and laughter, but they do not intrude uncomfortably. We played it over Christmas to get to know our daughter's new partner better, and it was fun and interesting. It's not a game you would repeat with the same people more than perhaps once a year.
customer_reviews.author: Glenna D.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The questions seem to just ask the same thing in a different way. Played with multiple family members all different adult ages. Not sure it was a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Cynowa

customer_reviews.title: Small and underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: A smaller, less creative take on Table Topic Cards, which have been around for years. Those come in many themes and have at least 3 times as many cards in a pack for about the same cost. Good idea, but needs to be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a teen group game. The kids loved it and wanted to keep playing even after our time was up! A bit pricier than I would have liked but I bought on the recommendation of a friend and wasn’t disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome

customer_reviews.title: Positive questions that deepen relationships
customer_reviews.text: Love this game, still haven't played it as a game yet actually, but I did look at how you play and that also looks like it would be way more fun than just everyone answering the questions and it would get everyone to know each other better to another level. The questions are great and push everyone to think of the positive which is something I very much appreciate. Definitely deepens your relationships
customer_reviews.author: Derek Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome conversation boosters
customer_reviews.text: My family started out less than engaged but as questions continued their reflections were more meaningful. It turned out to be a very nice way to express thanksgiving and it was fun. Much appreciation.
customer_reviews.author: SamRich

customer_reviews.title: Very Enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: Brought this out with family, age 13-74. Everyone participated and we ALL learned new things about each other. Allowed my Grandson to really learn how to “open up” and be more vulnerable with those that love him and feel safe. Very happy I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: LUVSTAWKIN

customer_reviews.title: Cute concept. Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy many of the questions in these cards, but for the price I feel that it could offer more.
customer_reviews.author: Ti Kitsune

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful idea, not a hit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to give away as gifts. Nobody was excited to get it. And when we played nobody was enjoying the questions. I love the idea of it creating meaningful conversations...but in reality, it ended up being rather boring until we decided to add the words "in bed" to the end of the questions. Need better questions!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great communication tool
customer_reviews.text: Played this game with my nephew, neighbor (a retired psychologist) and my husband. We never could figure out scoring but that did not matter to us anyway. It was a great way to have some real meaningful conversations and deeper communication. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Blackwell-Martin

customer_reviews.title: Impressive G-Rated Game for Adults
customer_reviews.text: We played this on NYE during my neighborhood NYE gathering and we really enjoyed getting to know each other better. It really created high-quality conversations.
customer_reviews.author: mwiscount

customer_reviews.title: Good to play with Family
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay. It worked okay with family after Thanksgiving Dinner, but I think it would be tough with just casual friends to share real personal thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing game for mindful folks
customer_reviews.text: this game is amazing. really brought out friend group together on New Year's Eve and again at a birthday party a couple weeks later. i highly recommend for mindful people looking for fun ways to connect. i hope they come out with more products because i will happily continue to support this company.
customer_reviews.author: Cavewoman15

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: What a great game! It brought my family together in the best way possible. Really made our night and can’t wait to play again
customer_reviews.author: Happystar

customer_reviews.title: Sorta of disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought this game would be fun but we tried it over the holidays and everyone seemed to lose interest quickly
customer_reviews.author: J. Loving

customer_reviews.title: It’s fun, will use it some more
customer_reviews.text: It is now invasive and thoughtful. A fun way to get to know more about people. I’m not for games, but this involves everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B. Wojcik

customer_reviews.title: Great conversation starter
customer_reviews.text: Carry this game in my purse and have pulled it out when awkward silence becomes a reality. Perfect for new and old friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it works!
customer_reviews.text: This worked! We had a REAL conversation amongst my family -- and learned things about each other we would never have known to ask. Thanks, Vertellis for a lovely (sometimes even painful) Xmas get together.
customer_reviews.author: Martha M

customer_reviews.title: Good but not our favorite family game
customer_reviews.text: This game was fun. We played it as a family once. There needs to be more cards. If you play it a few times you are uninterested after a bit because you've gone through the cards. Having said that, we did enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Baldwin-Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game!!!
customer_reviews.text: The questions really help the players open up about themselves. Everyone loved it. I recommend this for dinners or holidays.
customer_reviews.author: mikey

customer_reviews.title: I think good Holiday family game, maybe not the the age group, depends on the family.
customer_reviews.text: A good family game, you have to be ready to tell things honestly, it was funny at times, and very serious. Just keep open minded.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Fun game. Not a lot of questions and if you play it often it will become redundant. The positives are that it evokes interesting conversation and introspection. Worth it to have for a fun get to know game!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holroyd

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced deck of cards
customer_reviews.text: This game is the size of a deck of cards. Realistically, this product has an $8 value. Far overpriced for what you receive.
customer_reviews.author: J. Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Especially great for New Years’ reflection, Thanksgiving, etx
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool conversation starter. We played this with close friends and family on New Years Eve. Was a great way to reflect on the year while also having fun. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and enlightening!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to family Zoom calls! From my 4 year old granddaughter to my 90 year old mother! It kept everyone engaged and was uplifting and positive!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Schnyder

customer_reviews.title: Team or family building
customer_reviews.text: Thought provoking cards, suitable for business or a lazy day with friends by the fire or pool. I haven’t come across any cards that were too edgy for team building. They aren’t laugh out loud conversations.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Hall

customer_reviews.title: Better than small talk!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the holidays-they have really great questions to get discussions started-looking forward to using them!!
customer_reviews.author: Meena

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: This product came on time and as it appeared onliine. I got this game to use the questions as ice breakers for when we have people over. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mirella Stalnaker

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not much fun! Waste of money. Since I didn't use it right away, I couldn't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Creates great interaction
customer_reviews.text: We played informally after Christmas dinner. Creates good interaction. Then I gave it to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Giberson

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed the sweet family time with 4 college kids who are usually not too involved ...loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Our family played it during our Christmas holiday and I was pleased that everyone joined in. Even my college grandkids who are normally on their cell phones all the time got involved . We talked more as a family than we had in a long time. I thought it was a little pricey but we enjoyed everyone opening up and communicating like never before, so i guess it was worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: janet little

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a nice break from it electronic games. We sat around for two hours and had great discussions
customer_reviews.author: Marci W

customer_reviews.title: Not so hreat
customer_reviews.text: This game really didn’t meet my expectations. There were so many ads for it, I thought it would be great but it’s not.
customer_reviews.author: C Heron

customer_reviews.title: This is a great game for a family or friends.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for a family or friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun game.
customer_reviews.text: We played the game before dessert On Thanksgiving day. It was very fun and we got to know a lot about each other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Delightful multi generational game
customer_reviews.text: What a fun game we played Christmas Eve together. We were 7 players from the the ages of 13 to 74 and we had a blast playing this conversational game which lasted about an hour and 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: JCshahla

customer_reviews.title: didn't know it plays better when you have a bigger family or more people ...
customer_reviews.text: didn't know it plays better when you have a bigger family or more people present. I have a small family and was hoping two or three people could enjoy it. Haven't played the game yet, once we read better with a group
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great gift to get people to interact.
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly and gifted them as gifts for Christmas. They were a huge hit and everyone loved them. It was a great way to learn about each other and get conversations going. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love This
customer_reviews.text: I will use it for a group I will facilitate about self-compassion.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good conversation starter
customer_reviews.text: Used at the dinner table with adult children. Fun conversation starter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly liked!!️
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes this...it was a side gift and I thought he’d never use it. That said, it sits on his desk and he says he likes it. Who knew?
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy3339

customer_reviews.title: Question game but all questions are not great
customer_reviews.text: Not as interesting as other games...a bit too serious and personal.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: My opinion is this game is good for young families with elementary - junior high age ...
customer_reviews.text: My opinion is this game is good for young families with elementary - junior high age children. Good conversation starters.
customer_reviews.author: NW Girl

customer_reviews.title: Deep thoughts game
customer_reviews.text: The questions make you think deeply: some we're great and inspiring, and some questions seemed more depressing. Definitely something to play with people you want to know on a more personal basis.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Conversations
customer_reviews.text: If you know the person you play with, kind of boring. Might be really good for newlyweds or for friends getting together. The questions are very good, though. I recommend it for friends getting together.
customer_reviews.author: Red Bigly

customer_reviews.title: Brings families together
customer_reviews.text: This game brought the family together to connect, laugh, ask questions.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

product_meta.title: Vertellis Holiday Edition Card Game | Thoughtful Conversation Starters & Questions for Groups, Families, Friends, Office | Mindfulness & Communication Building Icebreaker Game for Parties & Gatherings
feature_bullets: ✅ STARTS GREAT CONVERSATIONS – Our conversation cards are designed to get you past small talk and have genuine conversations. The Holiday edition was created to start an open atmosphere for conversation at gatherings between family, friends, and colleagues. Make your next gathering, dinner, or reunion with family and friends more meaningful with Vertellis playing cards.

✅ FORGES STRONG BONDS – Our family card games feature conversation starter cards that lead to interesting discoveries about the people you care about. Everyone gets to open up about themselves, fostering a feeling of intimacy.

✅ UNIQUE DESIGN – This game is the brainchild of friends & family looking for deeper connections. No other card game looks like it. The deck is made up of 46 questions divided into four rounds, making for hours of fun question games.

✅ HIGHLY PORTABLE – With dimensions of 4x4x1 inches, our icebreaker games are ultra-portable. Take it with you anywhere you go, even on vacation trips. It also makes a great party game for adults and kids. Bring people together, whether at grandpa's place or at work.

✅ THE PERFECT ACCESSORY OR GIFT – Looking for things to do when bored? Cozy up with a game that will bring loved ones closer. Keep the holiday spirit of love and family burning bright all year. Vertellis makes a perfect gift for any occasion, whether it's gifts for him, gifts for her, or family & couples gifts.
